instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4652: What is 820-4652? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
Hi.

I have this imac which power on but has a 10sec delay once the power button is pressed. Any advice?

Thanks

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
10s until chime, or until image appears?
Any history available?

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Until chime and the board was replaced before as the client has been told by an Apple Reseller(they don't do repairs)

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
So the problem appeared after board was changed?
Who changed it?

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: A shop which is an official reseller but really no experience in repair except replacing full parts. The board was replaced some time ago and now this problem appeared...

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
Doesn't board have warranty from that service?

If the board worked good for a while, how this problem appeared?
Any upgrade tried?

Nothing change doing PRAM reset?

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
Hi.

Back at this iMac again. No warranty as they usually do so needs to be solved. If any ideas let me know but anyway i'll have to go by schematics and check resistors etc. It always needs about 20-30sec until it starts then works fine. The power button i checked it's good. Pram no change

Many thanks

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
Upload original BIOS somewhere.
Is time to try clean ME.

BTW, what is the board code?

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: This iMac is the Bomb really strange i noticed when i just plug it in and leave it for 20-30sec it power on by itself... I'll disassemble it again to get the board code and download the Clear ME bios

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Board number is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4652</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
No idea if really clean ME, but try it...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tlrw75HcloqHaYY4cG64FhflmBkkgkk4/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: I got the chip out but it's reading it as 128kb....

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Clean its pins with IPA (if SOP8 chip) and be sure to get good contacts in programmer socket.

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Tried a few times still same with 2 different programmers. I replace the chip now and programmed Clean ME the delay is 5-7sec now but not perfect. I'll try with new SSD to install and see if it's gonna be fine

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: I managed to program the original chip with clean ME and still there's a delay and even power on by itself after 20-30sec when just plugged in to power(with or without the power button plugged in)  :ROFLMAO: :unsure:

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: The power on problem was present before?

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: The client noticed in the past few weeks...

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: If you have Medusa programmer, clean ME yourself.

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Hi. I'm getting back to this iMac. I reprogrammed the bios with a new chip cause the old one was bad wasn't reading it properly on 2 programmers. With the new chip and Bios i have all Rails but no power still just 1 light comes on

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Do you get CPU core voltage too (with 1 LED only)?

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: I'll check and revert...

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Nothing on <CAPACITOR>C1030</CAPACITOR> that row... <SIGNAL>PPCPUVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
"i have all Rails"
Please, post the exact voltages you get on the board; because all are not present for sure.

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Okey i'll measure again and revert. Thanks

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP12V_ACDC</SIGNAL> - 12v
<SIGNAL>PP12V_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12v
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S5</SIGNAL> -12v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0</SIGNAL> - 12v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_ENET</SIGNAL> - 3.3v 

Did i miss some...?
:ROFLMAO:

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
Many.
As you get S0 voltages, then you must have many coils with voltage; which ones?
You've reported missing CPU core, but another coils must get voltage before.

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Atm it's staying on 1 Led and not powering on at all even when button is pressed. I get 3.3v on power button and i reprogrammed the bios it powered on few times with it and stopped just stays like that now

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
"i reprogrammed the bios it powered on few times with it"
Just turned on, or booted?

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message: Booted but still the same as before with the delay and now it's just no power with 1 led on

threads.title: iMac A1419
threads.message:
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR>, just in case.
If still the same, consider to change the PCH.
